alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Hennepin; Ramsey; Washington (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 29 at 10:46PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN HENNEPIN...SOUTHERN ANOKA...NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON AND NORTHERN RAMSEY COUNTIES THROUGH 1115 PM CDT... At 1045 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Spring Lake Park, or 11 miles north of Minneapolis, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Minneapolis, Brooklyn Park, Coon Rapids, Blaine, Andover, Brooklyn Center, Fridley, Shoreview, White Bear Lake, Champlin, New Brighton, and Lino Lakes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 130 and 132. U.S. Highway 8 in Minnesota near mile marker 0. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
